what: Load the package and example file
title: Basic Usage of cpp11qpdf
text: Load cpp11qpdf package set path example PDF file included R demonstration purposes.
code: library(cpp11qpdf) input_pdf <- system.file("examples", "sufganiyot.pdf", package = "cpp11qpdf")

title: Basic Usage of cpp11qpdf
text: compress PDF file, use pdf_compress function. function takes input PDF file output file path.
code: output_pdf <- tempfile(fileext = ".pdf") pdf_compress(input_pdf, output_pdf, password = "") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpzN0d8Y/file280f832529efe.pdf" file.exists(output_pdf) #> [1] TRUE

title: Basic Usage of cpp11qpdf
text: rotate pages PDF, use pdf_rotate_pages function. function takes input PDF file, pages rotate, angle rotation, output file path.
code: output_pdf <- tempfile(fileext = ".pdf") pdf_rotate_pages(input_pdf, pages = 1, angle = 90, output = output_pdf,   password = "") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpzN0d8Y/file280f87bab7363.pdf" file.exists(output_pdf) #> [1] TRUE

title: Basic Usage of cpp11qpdf
text: split PDF individual pages, use pdf_split function. function takes input PDF file output file prefix.
code: output_prefix <- tempfile() output_files <- pdf_split(input_pdf, output_prefix, password = "") output_files #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpzN0d8Y/file280f827d391f8_1.pdf" #> [2] "/tmp/RtmpzN0d8Y/file280f827d391f8_2.pdf"

title: Basic Usage of cpp11qpdf
text: combine multiple PDF files single PDF, use pdf_combine function. function takes vector input PDF files output file path.
code: # using the output files from the previous example output_pdf <- tempfile(fileext = ".pdf") pdf_combine(output_files, output_pdf, password = "") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpzN0d8Y/file280f874a67e60.pdf" file.exists(output_pdf) #> [1] TRUE

title: Basic Usage of cpp11qpdf
text: extract specific pages PDF, use pdf_subset function. function takes input PDF file, pages extract, output file path.
code: output_pdf <- tempfile(fileext = ".pdf") pdf_subset(input_pdf, 1, output_pdf, password = "") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpzN0d8Y/file280f880dfbcc.pdf" file.exists(output_pdf) #> [1] TRUE

what: Overlaying a Stamp on a PDF
title: Basic Usage of cpp11qpdf
text: overlay stamp page PDF, use pdf_overlay_stamp function. function takes input PDF file, stamp PDF file, output file path. Now pages header part original PDF.
code: stamp_pdf <- system.file("examples", "header.pdf", package = "cpp11qpdf") output_pdf <- tempfile(fileext = ".pdf") pdf_overlay_stamp(input_pdf, stamp_pdf, output_pdf, password = "") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpzN0d8Y/file280f888e2308.pdf" file.exists(output_pdf) #> [1] TRUE

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mauricio Vargas Sepulveda. Author, maintainer. Jeroen Ooms. Author.            Author qpdf R package Ben Raymond. Contributor. Jay Berkenbilt. Copyright holder.           Author qpdf Munk School Global Affairs Public Policy. Funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Vargas Sepulveda M, Ooms J (2024). cpp11qpdf: Split, Combine Compress PDF Files. R package version 0.1.0, https://pacha.dev/cpp11qpdf/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {cpp11qpdf: Split, Combine and Compress PDF Files},   author = {Mauricio {Vargas Sepulveda} and Jeroen Ooms},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://pacha.dev/cpp11qpdf/}, }

title: Split, Combine and Compress PDF Files
text: cpp11qpdf package provides set functions manipulate PDF files using qpdf library. fork qpdf uses cpp11 require licensing security purposes.

title: Split, Combine and Compress PDF Files
text: can install development version cpp11qpdf like :
code: remotes::install_github("pachadotdev/cpp11qpdf")

title: Split, Combine and Compress PDF Files
text: See vignette examples.
code: tmpdir <- tempdir() library(cpp11qpdf) file <- file.path(Sys.getenv("R_DOC_DIR"), "NEWS.pdf") pdf_compress(file, file.path(tmpdir, "output.pdf")) #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpqX9z6s/output.pdf"

what: Split, Combine and Compress PDF Files — cpp11qpdf-package
title: Split, Combine and Compress PDF Files — cpp11qpdf-package
text: Bindings 'cpp11qpdf': tool content-preserving transformations PDF files  split, combine, compress.

title: Split, Combine and Compress PDF Files — cpp11qpdf-package
text: Maintainer: Mauricio Vargas Sepulveda m.sepulveda@mail.utoronto.ca (ORCID) Authors: Jeroen Ooms jeroen@berkeley.edu (ORCID) (Author qpdf R package) contributors: Ben Raymond [contributor] Jay Berkenbilt (Author qpdf) [copyright holder] Munk School Global Affairs Public Policy [funder]

what: Combine multiple pdf files into a single pdf file — pdf_combine
title: Combine multiple pdf files into a single pdf file — pdf_combine
text: Combine multiple pdf files single pdf file

title: Combine multiple pdf files into a single pdf file — pdf_combine
code: pdf_combine(input, output = NULL, password = "")

title: Combine multiple pdf files into a single pdf file — pdf_combine
text: input path url input pdf file output base path output file(s) password string password open pdf file

title: Combine multiple pdf files into a single pdf file — pdf_combine
text: character vector path combined pdf file

title: Combine multiple pdf files into a single pdf file — pdf_combine
code: pdf_file <- system.file("examples", "sufganiyot.pdf", package = "cpp11qpdf") fout <- tempfile() pdf_combine(pdf_file, fout, "") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpOgvruH/file27fb41ed4e336.pdf"

title: Compress a pdf file — pdf_compress
text: Compress pdf file

title: Compress a pdf file — pdf_compress
code: pdf_compress(input, output = NULL, linearize = FALSE, password = "")

title: Compress a pdf file — pdf_compress
text: input path url input pdf file output base path output file(s) linearize enable pdf linearization (streamable pdf) password string password open pdf file

title: Compress a pdf file — pdf_compress
text: character vector path compressed pdf file

title: Compress a pdf file — pdf_compress
code: pdf_file <- system.file("examples", "sufganiyot.pdf", package = "cpp11qpdf") fout <- tempfile() pdf_compress(pdf_file, fout, TRUE, "") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpOgvruH/file27fb43939075d.pdf"

what: Get the number of pages in a pdf file — pdf_length
title: Get the number of pages in a pdf file — pdf_length
text: Get number pages pdf file

title: Get the number of pages in a pdf file — pdf_length
code: pdf_length(input, password = "")

title: Get the number of pages in a pdf file — pdf_length
text: input path url input pdf file password string password open pdf file

title: Get the number of pages in a pdf file — pdf_length
text: integer value number pages pdf file

title: Get the number of pages in a pdf file — pdf_length
code: pdf_file <- system.file("examples", "sufganiyot.pdf", package = "cpp11qpdf") pdf_length(pdf_file, "") #> [1] 2

what: Overlay a pdf file into another pdf file — pdf_overlay_stamp
title: Overlay a pdf file into another pdf file — pdf_overlay_stamp
text: Overlay pdf file another pdf file

title: Overlay a pdf file into another pdf file — pdf_overlay_stamp
code: pdf_overlay_stamp(input, stamp, output = NULL, password = "")

title: Overlay a pdf file into another pdf file — pdf_overlay_stamp
text: input path url input pdf file stamp pdf file first page overlayed page input output base path output file(s) password string password open pdf file

title: Overlay a pdf file into another pdf file — pdf_overlay_stamp
text: character vector path stamped pdf file

title: Overlay a pdf file into another pdf file — pdf_overlay_stamp
code: pdf_file <- system.file("examples", "sufganiyot.pdf", package = "cpp11qpdf") stamp_file <- system.file("examples", "header.pdf", package = "cpp11qpdf") fout <- tempfile() pdf_overlay_stamp(pdf_file, stamp_file, fout, "") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpOgvruH/file27fb4ebe7b17.pdf"

what: Rotate pages in a pdf file — pdf_rotate_pages
title: Rotate pages in a pdf file — pdf_rotate_pages
text: Rotate pages pdf file

title: Rotate pages in a pdf file — pdf_rotate_pages
code: pdf_rotate_pages(   input,   pages,   angle = 90,   relative = FALSE,   output = NULL,   password = "" )

title: Rotate pages in a pdf file — pdf_rotate_pages
text: input path url input pdf file pages vector page numbers rotate angle rotation angle degrees (positive = clockwise) relative TRUE, pages rotated relative current orientation. FALSE, rotation absolute (0 = portrait, 90 = landscape, rotated 90 degrees clockwise portrait) output base path output file(s) password string password open pdf file

title: Rotate pages in a pdf file — pdf_rotate_pages
text: character vector path rotated pdf file

title: Rotate pages in a pdf file — pdf_rotate_pages
code: pdf_file <- system.file("examples", "sufganiyot.pdf", package = "cpp11qpdf") fout <- tempfile() pdf_rotate_pages(pdf_file, 1, 90, FALSE, fout, "") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpOgvruH/file27fb4165bc58c.pdf"

what: Split a pdf file into individual pages — pdf_split
title: Split a pdf file into individual pages — pdf_split
text: Split pdf file individual pages

title: Split a pdf file into individual pages — pdf_split
code: pdf_split(input, output = NULL, password = "")

title: Split a pdf file into individual pages — pdf_split
text: input path url input pdf file output base path output file(s) password string password open pdf file

title: Split a pdf file into individual pages — pdf_split
text: character vector paths split pdf files

title: Split a pdf file into individual pages — pdf_split
code: # extract some pages pdf_file <- system.file("examples", "sufganiyot.pdf", package = "cpp11qpdf") fout <- tempfile() pdf_split(pdf_file, fout, password = "") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpOgvruH/file27fb4ef3830d_1.pdf" #> [2] "/tmp/RtmpOgvruH/file27fb4ef3830d_2.pdf"

what: Subset a pdf file to a new pdf file containing the selected pages — pdf_subset
title: Subset a pdf file to a new pdf file containing the selected pages — pdf_subset
text: Subset pdf file new pdf file containing selected pages

title: Subset a pdf file to a new pdf file containing the selected pages — pdf_subset
code: pdf_subset(input, pages = 1, output = NULL, password = "")

title: Subset a pdf file to a new pdf file containing the selected pages — pdf_subset
text: input path url input pdf file pages vector page numbers select. Negative numbers means removing pages (R indexing) output base path output file(s) password string password open pdf file

title: Subset a pdf file to a new pdf file containing the selected pages — pdf_subset
text: character vector path subsetted pdf file

title: Subset a pdf file to a new pdf file containing the selected pages — pdf_subset
code: pdf_file <- system.file("examples", "sufganiyot.pdf", package = "cpp11qpdf") fout <- tempfile() pdf_subset(pdf_file, 1, fout, "") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpOgvruH/file27fb4109aa299.pdf"
